name: CommonNonotitisChildhoodBacterialInfections
title: Common Nonotitis Childhood Bacterial Infections
purpose: (Clinical Focus: This code cluster is intended to capture diagnoses of the most common indications for antibiotic therapy in childhood, other than acute otitis media),(Data Element Scope: Diagnosis codes for conditions occurring most commonly in otherwise healthy children that are frequently reasons for antibiotic prescription),(Inclusion Criteria: Non-otitis diagnosis codes appearing most frequently in an unselected population of children 12 years old or younger for infections in which bacterial pathogens are a common consideration.  The diagnosis code for "Acute pharyngitis" is included, despite presence of a more specific code for streptococcal pharyngitis, based on assessment of code utilization in a large pediatric health system.),(Exclusion Criteria: Diagnosis codes reflecting likely viral origin)
